text: Pyrausta zonalis is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by William Barnes and James Halliday McDunnough in 1918. It is found in North America, where it has been recorded from Texas, Arizona and California. The wingspan is about 15–16 mm. The forewings are deep smoky brown. The hindwings are dull smoky.Contributions to the Natural History of the Lepidoptera of North America 4 (2): 164 Adults have been recorded on wing in February, from April to August and in October. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1918 zonalis Category:Moths of North America
title: Pyrausta zonalis
